Key Match Events: Kuldeep Yadav dismissed Tanzid Hasan (51) via an LBW in the 14.4 over
Najmul Hossain Shanto was dismissed by R Jadeja via an LBW in the 20th over
Litton Das lost his wicket to Ravindra Jadeja in the 27.4 over
Mushfiqur Rahim was dismissed by Bumrah in the 43rd over
Pre-Game Insights: India have a 3-1 record against Bangladesh in World Cups
In the last four ODIs played between the two teams, Bangladesh have beaten India thrice
Bangladesh won the toss and elected to bat first
There are no big teams in the World Cup. Whenever you start focusing only on bigger teams, an upset happens
You have to play your best against all these bowlers, and if you aren't able to, these bowlers are able to create pressure and increase the chances of getting you out
Post-Match Reflections: Virat Kohli expressed pride in the team's resilience after a close win
Shakib-Al-Hasan became the Player of the Match in the 2011 World Cup clash

Miscellaneous Highlights: Bangladesh's skipper Shakib-Al-Hasan missed the game against New Zealand
Bangladesh's Najmul Hossain Shanto has taken over as captain in his absence
Rohit Sharma received three traffic challans for speeding on the Mumbai-Pune Expressway
Rohit Sharma fell on the score of 48 after playing an entertaining innings as caught by Towhid Hridoy
Shubman Gill reached his 10th ODI fifty
Virat Kohli anchored India's 257-run chase with an unbeaten 103
Others: India's Man of the Match was Virat Kohli
Bangladesh won the toss and decided to bat first
India needed 257 runs to win the match
